name: 歐洲旅行文學研究專題
goals: The constant communication between the acquired knowledge and the practical experience is the basic requirement in the development of learning.
The application of classroom knowledge to the practical experience helps students to be familiar with the future challenge. A video presentation is required for the class.
The mode of philosophical and ethical inquiry in a simulated international context is the way to develop capacities for independent judgment, critical thinking, and ethical reasoning.
The goal of this course is the ultimate concern with the other literature and culture (or, the literature and culture of the other) through the speculative mode of thinking

methodologies.note: The instructor will conduct mostly interactive lectures.
Questions will be prepared for the students to discuss.
Problems will be assigned to students who work as a team to solve them.
Students will be teamed up to do the oral presentation.
Five field trips will be integrated into the teaching process.
Students are required to do a short video, and upload it to YouTube.

grading.note: Students’ contribution to the class discussion
Being present in the class means to share their opinions with the participants

prerequisite: ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
